attributes.action: Class gyms as essential, allow them to stay open during UK lockdowns.
attributes.additional_details:
The health of the nation is of the upmost importance during a pandemic. The health benefits of exercising - both physical and mental - are astronomical. Taking these facilities away from the public who rely on them for their physical & mental well-being will decrease the overall health of the nation, which will lead to an increased strain on the NHS & more lives will be unnecessarily lost. 
Gyms are safe to open. Your nation needs its gyms. Keep them open. Keep your nation healthy.
attributes.background:
We would like the UK Government to class gyms & leisure facilities as ‘essential’ in regards to the COVID-19 pandemic lockdowns. 
This means they will be able to remain open, adhering to safety guidelines, throughout this, and any future UK lockdowns.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons
